column5: Seen this. Interesting . I guess the minnow harvester had something to do with this happening. They are on every gate to the docks as well. Wonder if this means no ice fishing as well ?
I guess we'll see how it plays out once the ice gets there.

Speaking of ice, slush ice going down the river and the shore line is froze out 8 ft where I was this morning. Not a good start for my river fishing holidays. LOL Might need to get all my ice gear and check out some crappy lakes.
If you can access the ice without using the docks I wonder if they will chase you away.Â  Maybe Barrie "owns" the inner harbour area.
Email has been sent with questions .
What's a person to do between a wedding ceremony and a reception now???

The groom above just got himself a keeper. About 15 years ago they posted "NO FISHING" signs on the Port Dover pier here on Lake Erie. It is packed with pier fisher people looking for Perch from ice out to fall.Not everyone is blessed to have a boat.Â  I stirred the pot locally and there was actually a protest and people showed up. I don't think there is anything better to me than to see a few kids riding their bikes with a rod and reel strapped to their back. Better fishing than hanging around the Mall or in front of an X Box. They took the signs down. The Feds said it was a liability issue. I guess only fisher persons fall into the water let alone the kids that dive off the end of the pier at any given time.
Catch dinner, or wedding gift?
We were fishing for a bottle of screech for Misfish... had to settle for a perch!
The groom was grooming the keeper while they were fishing. ðŸ¤£
Or vicey vercy.
Always said, a kid with a fishing rod isn't robbing granny or grandpas.
Exactly Fisherman, exactly.
Wish my wife let us do that at our wedding!
LOL.. we were the guests, apparently Brian was out getting lucky in between !

My reply from the city  Thank you for your inquiry.  The City of Barrie Marina has maintained a No Fishing policy during the operating season for many years.  These specific signs are to discourage fishing and minnow harvesting from the Marina docks specifically. The docks are City property, and only those with and MNR issued Commercial Bait Harvesting Licence and permitted by the City may access the Marina docks in the non-boating season.  You are free to ice fish anywhere on the Lake, but we ask that you not walk or access our docks while doing so.
Someone there needs a spelling and grammer lesson!
Maybe he,s a newf, like me. LOL
Yet you spelled grammer wrong ....should be grammAr LOL
Yup, just checked, good catch Lew. ðŸ¤£
Since I retired from fishing I seldom catch anything these days LOL

Hmmm? First they banned non residents from catching their own bait, now it has progressed to residents? As a citizen in possession of a valid license should you not be entitled to catch your own bait anywhere a commercial netter is allowed?
Thanks for posting.
I think someone had their hut out on Cook's bay for the weekend so it must be safe /s  	I saw a boat out on Kempenfelt bay this morning.
